intro: Polysphaeria cleistocalyx var. pedunculata, commonly known as the pedunculate starflower, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It prefers moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
